Monetary Union
1. All barriers to import and export of goods and services among the countries are
removed.
2. All countries adopt a common set of trade restrictions with non-members.
3. All barriers to the movement of labor and capital goods among member countries
are removed.
4. Member countries establish common institutions and economic policy for the
union.
5. Member countries adopt a single currency.
The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) is an example of a free trade area,
the European Union (EU) is an example of an economic union, and the euro zone is an
example of a monetary union.
